instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01814: What is 820-01814? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PP5_G3S: What is PP5_G3S? This is a typo of  When you see PP3V3_S0_DDC_LCD, assume they meant to type .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on after water damange
threads.message:
i have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> which has water damage at the speaker right AMP area. that was cleared but one of the amp <CHIP>U6500</CHIP> was roasted and cannot be fix, pads on the chip are gone(this can't be replaced right?). i have not replaced it and left it off the board

right now board takes 20V 20ma and does not boot. when going from 5v to 20v, it draws to about 200ma before dropping to 20ma
This is my first T2 board and have no experience or know about the boot progression process.

i have 
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.6v
<SIGNAL>PP5_G3S</SIGNAL> 5V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.3 Volt
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC_X</SIGNAL> 3.3 Volt
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> 0 Volt 

where is <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> generated? i don't see this in the schematic (using 01041 btw) and how do i troubleshoot this

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on after water damange
threads.message:
Probably bad T2, because of liquid spill.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Ym82H0hnMP13AnhxNAkprKvDFPR0LpMX/view?usp=sharing[/URL]
Check diode mode to ground at T2 data lines from audio connector.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on after water damange
threads.message:
when u say data lines from audio connector i presume these?
in diode mode
<SIGNAL>I2S_SPKRAP_R_LRCLK_R</SIGNAL> 0.4
<SIGNAL>I2S_SPKRAP_R_R2D</SIGNAL> 0.4
<SIGNAL>I2S_SPKRAP_R_BCLK</SIGNAL> 0.4

i2c lines are all 0.4 on left and right

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on after water damange
threads.message:
Sorry, I was thinking to Air board, with separate audio board.

In your case, T2 has direct connection with audio amps.
You should check diode mode on data lines between <CHIP>U6500</CHIP> and T2.
Like <SIGNAL>SPKRAMP_RESET_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SPKRAMP_INT_L</SIGNAL>, etc.

Most likely T2 is damaged, because <CHIP>U6500</CHIP> is powered on from <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on after water damange
threads.message: and i can confirm your statement  <SIGNAL>SPKRAMP_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is shorted to ground and T2 is glowing like a firefly in the dark
